official-title.#text:
Urging the Federal Aviation Administration
		  to continue its cooperation with airports across the United States seeking to
		  implement noise mitigation plans, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to continue its cooperation with airports across the
			 United States that are seeking to implement noise mitigation plans; and

to continue its implementation of the Next
			 Generation Air Transportation System (NextGen) and other efforts to enhance the
			 safety of air travel and help decrease noise levels.

text.#text: Whereas with the help of the

Whereas airport noise reduction programs must be designed
			 to meet the specific needs and concerns of airports and their surrounding
			 communities; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 provides a process by which airports may mandate restrictions on airport noise
			 and access with FAA approval: Now, therefore, be it

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subchapter II of chapter 475 of title 49, United
			 States Code
Airport Noise and Capacity Act of 1990
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Airport Noise and Capacity Act of 1990
